column4: I have added a command to /etc/rc.local because i need it to start before login.  When I run the command from the console it runs, but the same command /appears/ to fail when run from the rc.local file.  Is there somewhere I can see why it failed?
Maybe it needs a service like DBus to be running
Or maybe it's a command that you need to run as a user, not as roto?
is there somewhere errors get logged so I can see what is happening?   I'm running it with sudo -u me BUNDLE_GEMFILE=/home/code/library/Gemfile  /usr/bin/merb -m /home/code/elibrary
You can output stderr to a file by putting "2>>/path/to/a/file" at the end
You don't have encrypted home directory, do you?
Also, try changing "-u" to "-iu" to simulate inital login and setup env vars properly
Without that, the wrong $HOME and other env vars will be set, and the command could fail reading config files, etc.
makes sense.  I'll get back in a few  thanks!
I have to leave for ~30 min right now
So if the problem persists after that, I'll be back later
Sorry was gone longer than I intended. Did you get it worked out?
